From the moment I opened the side door off the car port of Killgore Cottage I was in awe. Attention to decore, ambience and cleanliness were immediately apparent. On a stifling Louisiana day the house was enticingly cool with AC and ceiling fans running. As I moved through the house lamps provided a dimly lit path revealing a collection of vintage treasures and the overhead light switches. It was apparent I was both expected and being invited in.
As a lone traveller I felt safe in Killgore cottage and in the residential neighborhood I temporarily joined.
I found it ideally situated for my purpose and during the hottest part of the August days a welcoming retreat.
From condiments to soaps and cleaning supplies so many extras were provided.
I left Haynesville contentedly knowing I have a cozy Louisiana home to return to on my next visit.
Beverlee and Keith are amazing hosts; they’re friendly and welcoming, very responsive to communication and considerate of guest privacy.

review_text: This is a super cute, recently remodeled, fully stocked for a long term stay, three bedroom home, located about 2 blocks from a park and almost in the middle of the tiny town. The front porch is perfect for sipping your favorite beverage and watching the neighbors drive by. The screened in back porch is shaded by a large tree and presents a relaxed place to contemplate. The large back yard, shaded by the same tree is a wonderful place to do yoga & watch the neighborhood birds. Basically everyone is friendly and will wave at you as you sit on the porch, walk around town, or talk to you if you run into them at the Piggly Wiggly. There are a handful of restaurants in town one can support. The downtown area has great potential. I personally feel that if the town had a few festivals during the year, perhaps a farmers market (not sure if I missed one), got the downtown spiced up with perhaps local artists, farmers, beekeepers, lemonade stands..whatever the peoples talents are, this town could be even more amazing. From this cute home to the church bells ringing throughout the day to the trains that slowly pass thru town, occasionally blowing their whistles, & the wonderful people. You may just want to stay longer. : )

Corey and Christie's place was perfect for our family of 5 (this includes our 2 fur babies)! We also had our 7-month old niece over for a night. Perfect! Perfect! Perfect! Check in was a breeze, communication was effortless and the home was much more spacious than we'd anticipated. Matter of fact, we were expecting an apartment but what we got was more of a duplex-two-family home, and quite stylish with lots of thoughtful extra touches. There were plenty of comfy plush towels, and the place was immaculately clean. Normally, I don't book Airbnb stays where the owner lives on property due to my desire for absolute privacy. However, I never would've known the owners lived next door had they not mentioned it. We were given all of the autonomy needed to enjoy the space as our own. The outside seating area was a fantastic plus with a basketball goal our 7-year old son and his 6-year old cousin thoroughly enjoyed. The waterfall and Zen garden were perfect for our morning mediations, and the guidebook provided by the hosts was extremely helpful and saved us lots of time when ordering in.
The only thing I'd say is the car wash next door can get a little loud throughout the day and late at night. However, traveling from the city (New York) to the south, you don't consider that real noise. Needless to say, we slept right through it! Someone looking for a bit more silence may not feel the same.
We loved our stay so much that we extended it for another night and would undoubtedly return for another visit.
